alert.note: Alert for Henry; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 10:18PM CDT until July 29 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR EASTERN WHITESIDE...NORTHEASTERN HENRY AND NORTHERN BUREAU COUNTIES... At 1017 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Steward to Putnam, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Sterling, Rock Falls, Princeton, Spring Valley, Walnut, Ladd, Tampico, La Moille, Dalzell, Deer Grove, Emerson, Ohio, Cherry, Yorktown, Malden, Manlius, Seatonville, Arlington, Dover and New Bedford. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
